skill.name: ship-cli
skill.description: Work management system replacing built-in todos with tracked tasks and stacked changes
skill.summary: Work management system replacing built-in todos with tracked tasks and stacked changes
skill.author: EduSantosBrito

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill with no executable code. Contains only documentation and workflow instructions for using the external 'ship' CLI tool. No scripts, network access, filesystem operations, or code execution capabilities.

content.user_title: Manage tasks and track stacked changes
content.value_statement: Managing work across tasks, commits, and PRs is fragmented and error-prone. This skill provides a unified workflow for Linear task management with stacked changes using Jujutsu.
actual_capabilities: Track tasks through Linear integration with status updates
Create and manage stacked changes with Jujutsu VCS
Sync work with trunk and submit stacked PRs
Handle webhook events for GitHub notifications
limitations: Requires the 'ship' CLI tool to be installed separately
Works with Linear for task tracking - other tools not supported
Jujutsu (jj) must be configured for version control operations

use_cases.title: Track personal tasks
use_cases.description: Organize and track individual development tasks with integrated Linear and VCS workflow

use_cases.title: Coordinate team work
use_cases.description: Manage team progress with milestones, dependencies, and stacked PR reviews

use_cases.title: Submit clean PRs
use_cases.description: Create well-structured stacked changes for clean, reviewable pull requests

prompt_templates.title: Create stacked change
prompt_templates.prompt: ship: action=stack-create, message="feat: add new feature", bookmark="user/feature-slug"

prompt_templates.title: Submit work
prompt_templates.prompt: ship: action=stack-sync, workdir=/path && ship: action=stack-submit, workdir=/path

output_examples.input: I need to start working on a new feature
output: âœ“ Found 3 tasks ready to work on
Which task would you like to start?

best_practices: Always use workdir parameter for commands in workspaces
Run stack-sync before stack-submit to ensure clean history
Mark tasks as done only after PR is created and merged
anti_patterns: Running jj, gh pr, or git commands directly instead of using ship tool
Moving to next task before current PR is merged

faq.question: What tools do I need installed?
faq.answer: The 'ship' CLI tool, Jujutsu (jj), and a Linear workspace for task tracking.

faq.question: Does this work with GitHub?
faq.answer: Yes, ship integrates with GitHub for PR creation, reviews, and webhook notifications.

faq.question: Can I use this with GitLab?
faq.answer: Currently ship targets GitHub. Other platforms require custom integration.

faq.question: Is my data safe?
faq.answer: Yes, ship only reads and writes to your configured Linear and GitHub accounts.

faq.question: Why use stacked changes?
faq.answer: Stacked changes enable smaller, focused PRs that are easier to review and maintain.

faq.question: How is this different from git branches?
faq.answer: Stacked changes with Jujutsu track dependencies between commits, making complex work easier to manage.
